(Officer's individual report--under G. O. 41, A. G. O. 1890.)
To the ADJUTANT GENERAL OF THE ARMY.
SIR: I have the honor to report that I have given attention to the following special subjects:
1. In the line of the military profession. None

2. Professional or scientific study other than military. Pathological Histology
and Bacteriology.
4. Other special courses of reading, study, or investigation. See “Remarks”.

6. Remarks.
October '90 to October '91, a member of
the Class in Pathological Histology & Bacteriology
at the Johns Hopkins Hospital pathological laboratory
May '91 to October '91 engaged in special
study of the changes found in the human
liver in typhoid fever - also, experimental work
on animals, to confirm results found in
the human liver. These experiments were car-
ried on under the immediate supervision of
Prof. Wm Welch, of the Johns Hopkins University.

I have studied French and Spanish during
the past fifteen years, but have only
a reading knowledge of these languages.
Have engaged in the study of German, since
August '91.

Respectfully submitted.
Walter Reed,
Capt. & Asst. Surg. U.S.A.

NOTE.--If the officer has nothing to report, he will so state. Under “Remarks” give progress, method of study or investigation, length of
time occupied, results obtained, &c. If a foreign language has been studied, state whether reading or speaking knowledge has been obtained.
